docs.text:
this is the personal website of Isabel Burgos

github - bsky - fedi - twitter

docs.title: Now
docs.text: • documenting the restoration of a JEM-2100F at the University of Oregon: 2100F Circuit Board Photo Gallery

docs.title: Previously
docs.text: • designing an open source scan controller for electron microscopy - (documentation)

docs.title: JEM-2100F
docs.text:
The University of Oregon purchased this TEM from NUANCE at Northwestern University. It was relocated in December 2024.

Circuit Board Photo Gallery

docs.title: beam/shift
docs.text: Transmission electron microscopy notes, methods, and thinking.

docs.title: Imaging Conditions
docs.text:
Instrument: 200 kV TEM Source: LaB₆ Mode: Bright-field TEM Detector: CCD

Minor astigmatism observed during initial alignment. Contrast optimized after condenser aperture adjustment.

docs.title: Links and Navigation
docs.text:
This site is organized as a small, linked knowledge base. For example:

  • See the guides/intro.md for orientation
  • Jump directly to the API reference
  • Inline links like Material MkDocs should read clearly

docs.title: Code / Readouts
docs.text:
Inline values like 200 kV or 1.2 Å should feel like instrument annotations.

Accelerating voltage: 200 kV
Magnification:        120,000×
Camera length:        800 mm
Spot size:            3

# Example analysis stub
import numpy as np

fft = np.fft.fft2(image)
power = np.abs(fft)**2

docs.title: Figures
docs.text: Figure 1 — Bright-field image showing lattice fringes at high magnification.

docs.title: Tables (Acquisition Parameters)
docs.text: Parameter Value Notes Accelerating Voltage 200 kV Standard operation Objective Aperture 40 µm Inserted Defocus −1.5 µm Slight underfocus Exposure Time 0.5 s CCD limited

docs.title: Latex
docs.text: Block math: $\(\frac{x}{y} = e^i\)$ Inline math: \(\frac{x}{y} = e^i\)

docs.title: Callouts
docs.text:
Note

This is a general observation recorded during routine operation.

Warning

Misalignment at high magnification can lead to misleading contrast.

docs.title: Horizontal Rule and Sectioning
docs.text: Text above and below horizontal rules should feel like clearly separated panels or sections in an instrument interface.

docs.title: Emphasis and Annotation
docs.text:
Regular paragraph text should be easy to read over long stretches.

Italic text can be used for conditions, metadata, or interpretive notes.

Small annotations may appear as secondary analytical comments.

docs.title: Closing
docs.text: This page exists purely to preview typography, color, spacing, and layout. Replace it with real content once the visual language feels right.
